item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Erin add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Erin add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Tell your heart that the fear of suffering is worse than the suffering itself. And that no heart has ever suffered when it goes in search of its dreams, because every second of the search is a second's encounter with God and with eternity." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Atwood

item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erin add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint, or even remember it. It is enough." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Erin add a quote by Jane Addams
item.description: "Nothing could be worse than the fear that one had given up too soon, and left one unexpended effort that might have saved the world." -- Jane Addams

item.title: Erin add a quote by Michael Pollan
item.description: "The single greatest lesson the garden teaches is that our relationship to the planet need not be zero-sum, and that as long as the sun still shines and people still can plan and plant, think and do, we can, if we bother to try, find ways to provide for ourselves without diminishing the world. " -- Michael Pollan

item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erin add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Erin add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "I am grateful for all those dark years, even though in retrospect they seem like a long, bitter prayer that was answered finally." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "The real things haven't changed. It is still best to be honest and truthful; to make the most of what we have; to be happy with simple pleasures; and have courage when things go wrong." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder
